<img src="https://icompile.eladkarako.com/_uploads/2015/02/icompile.eladkarako.com_1x1_pixel_description_.png" alt="icompile.eladkarako.com_1x1_pixel_description_" width="348" height="429" class="alignright size-full wp-image-2517" />

One pixel graphic files, are mostly used now-days in some server-response, there are better some alternatives, such as responding with HTTP status 204 NO-CONTENT, which means the server successfully processed the request, but is not returning any content, 
its usually used as a response to a successful delete request, but as alternative to responding with one-pixel size image, <strong>Google</strong> is going that way in some of the console-API services...
...but anyway, responding with an image, is still, the more common-way.

I've include some of the non-standard formats (such as <code>PDF</code>), a possible use is in a web-application where, by default, process a image-based-pdf, this way you can use/process/return the following (a.k.a minimal one).

<table style="word-break:normal">
<tr><th>ext</th>  <th>size</th>        <th>base64</th></tr>
